publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-3833 Christine Grahame: Abbotsford House—That the Parliament welcomes the proposed £4,448,000 funding from the Heritage Lottery Fund giving the trustees of Abbotsford House two years to submit detailed proposals for the restoration of the house, which was the home of Sir Walter Scott and where he died in 1832, and notes that this is most appropriate in the Year of Homecoming.
S3M-3833 Abbotsford House (lodged on 30 March 2009) Aileen Campbell*, Kenneth Gibson*, Shirley-Anne Somerville*, Bill Kidd*, Bill Wilson*, Bob Doris*, Jamie Hepburn*
S3M-3833 Abbotsford House (lodged on 30 March 2009) Stuart McMillan*
S3M-3833 Abbotsford House (lodged on 30 March 2009) Maureen Watt*

S3M-3833 Christine Grahame: Abbotsford House—That the Parliament welcomes the proposed £4,448,000 of funding from the Heritage Lottery Fund, giving the trustees of Abbotsford House two years to submit detailed proposals for the restoration of the house, which was the home of Sir Walter Scott and where he died in 1832, and notes that this is most appropriate in the Year of Homecoming. Supported by: Aileen Campbell, Kenneth Gibson, Shirley-Anne Somerville, Bill Kidd, Bill Wilson, Bob Doris, Jamie Hepburn, Stuart McMillan, Maureen Watt
S3M-3833 Abbotsford House (lodged on 30 March 2009) Gil Paterson*
